fields.summary: Rapid Board doesn't display last word of issue summary
If an issue has no priority set we get the word "unassigned" where the icon should be which looks weird

fields.description:
Original summary: {{As a Supporter, I would like to be able to sort attachments by Date Uploaded in Rapid View}}

When using GH as a Kanban board for support, I want to be able to sort attachments in Detail view so I can quickly identify the most recent attachments for the end user
fields.summary: Ability to sort attachments in Agile detail view

fields.description:
In the pages mentioned here (in _Environment_ issue field), it is mentioned that
{quote}
A Cumulative Flow Diagram (CFD) is an area chart that shows work-in-progress for a product, version or *sprint*. The horizontal x-axis in a CFD indicates time, and the vertical y-axis indicates cards (issues). Each coloured area of the chart equates to a workflow status (i.e. a column on your board).
{quote}

This might create false hopes regarding the fact that the Cumulative Flow Diagram Report in GH 6 shows the whole sprint but the Cumulative Flow Chart Diagram Gadget only works with the old fixVersion concept.

Assuming I am not missing something, can we please edit these pages in order not to raise false hopes and point to the wrong direction?

Many thanks. (y)
fields.summary: Cumulative Flow Diagram Gadget does not work with Rapid Board Sprint, only a version (fixVersion)

fields.description:
This issue was originally opened for sprint support in the Classic Cumulative Flow Diagram gadget. It has since become a mixture of that request and the need for the same gadget for the (newer) Agile board report.
So I will change the original summary to reflect this state.



---
*Original summary*
Wallboard Cumulative Flow Chart Gadget cannot work with Rapid Board Sprints

*Original description*

{color:#707070}This comes from a dedicated customer using the Cumulative Flow Chart Gadget with the Classic Planning Board.

Reproduction steps:
# You create a new Rapid Board, named RP1 (e.g. a Scrum one). In RP1 you include two projects, Pr1 and Pr2.
# Then you create a Sprint, named S1
# In RP1, you drag and drop issues from both Pr1 and Pr2 to S1.
# Unlike the classic Planning Board (where issues are actually transferred into versions of the actual one project they are related to), issues are only transferred into S1. This is visible on the bottom right part of the issue in JIRA (under the Agile section)
# In RP1, you can click on Report and then, instead of Sprint Report, select Cumulative Flow Diagram. This depicts the Cumulative Flow Diagram for S1 (and can act as a temporary workaround) but:
# This is something you cannot have in the GreenHopper Cumulative Flow Chart Dashboard Gadget (also Wallboard capable) as you can only select a version, not a sprint.

Question: Shouldn't the Cumulative Flow Chart Gadget be able to work with Sprints instead of versions only?{color}
fields.summary: Ability to show the Cumulative Flow Diagram report as a gadget

fields.description: This would allow people to find the median time that issues take to be fixed or to be QAed or to pass through arbitrary stages of the issue lifecycle. The median is arguably a more useful time than the mean as it is less influenced by outliers.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see median time on scrum/kanban charts
Show agile type in Agile dropdown menu
Show agile type on Manage page

fields.description:
As a developer / manager, i would like to easily move an issue I am viewing into the current sprint.

Currently the best way to do this is to do "rank to top", then "rapid board" from the actions dropdown, then drag the issue into the sprint. It would be nice if i could short circuit that and just have a "put in current sprint" option in the actions dropdown.
fields.summary: Add issue action for putting the issue in the current sprint

fields.description:
If we create a quick filter on the rapid board and this filter includes sub-tasks, the filter doesn't display any sub-tasks on Plan mode of the Rapid Board.

If we go to the Work Mode, the sub-tasks are displayed correctly.

It would be a great improvement to be able to see the sub-tasks on the Plan Mode.
fields.summary: Quick filter that retrieves sub-tasks doesn't work properly on the Plan Mode of the Rapid Board
Better notification to users when the "Start Sprint" button is disabled

fields.description:
I've updated from 5.10.x to 6.0.1 and now it's not possible to show on a scrum board the original time estimate in the sprint planning. The big problem is that now the original time estimate is not the sum of the sub-tasks. So we can't use the rapid board anymore. :(
I hope this will fixed very fast!
fields.summary: Original time estimate on the rapidboard is not sum by sub-task

fields.description:
The Task Board is good, the rapid board has some catching up to do in terms of user experience (5.9.4 rapid board).

The rapid board should certainly have the progress bar & hours that the task board has now, they are very useful during a sprint (actually the progress bar should give an option between hours vs. # of tasks).

That feature alone might keeps us from migrating to the rapid board (though in general terms the UI of the Task Board still is organized better than the rapid board).
fields.summary: Rapid board should have the progress bar & sprint task hours left from the Task Board

at org.apache.velocity.util.introspection.UberspectImpl$VelMethodImpl.invoke(UberspectImpl.java:370)

fields.summary: Stacktrace when I clicked on "Agile"

fields.description: Its just nice to do a quick hours remaining calculation sometimes and we have grown very used to having this in the current version. Please can we have this back.
fields.summary: As a greenhopper 6 rapid board user I want to see a rapid report with hours so that I can see and track the teams hours remaining on a sprint.

fields.description:
As a business we cannot move to the new rapid boards unless we have this feature so its really critical for us and blocks us from upgrading any futher.

We have 3 teams working on 1 project and from 1 backlog. So each team has a filter to show certian parts of the backlog. They will add thier stories to the sprints. The problem is each team wants to see thier own reports (as defined by filters). The story defined would seem to solve this problem.
fields.summary: As a greenhopper 6 user I want the Quick Filters available on the Rapid Board Report view (as in Plan and Work mode) so that I can view reports by filter

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed several reflected and persisted cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities that affect GreenHopper instances, including publicly available instances (that is, Internet-facing servers). XSS vulnerabilities allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a GreenHopper page.

More details are available in the advisory at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+Security+Advisory+2012-08-21
fields.summary: Cross Site Scripting Vulnerabilities

fields.description:
I would like to be able to configure a column to always show issues of Project X in status Z. Or Project X, issue type z. Or any combination of those things.

The reason behind that is that our developer team wants to always be automatically aware of issues escalated by support team. We don't want to have to check the backlog of the Sprint and manually add the issues. We want them to appear automatically.
fields.summary: As an Scrum Rapid Board Administrator, I would like to have a column automatically populated whe an issue gets to a pre-defined status

fields.description:
From Mark Halvorson: 

The bug occurs when any subsequent boards are associated with a project based on the simplified workflow.

Here is a screencast that demonstrates the problem.

1)  Create Project & Board associated with simplified workflow.
2)  View configure screen and workflow.  All looks good.
3)  Go create a 2nd board associated with the same project.
4)  View configuration screen.  See extra status options that are not part of my workflow.  Ooops.
5)  View workflow.  Confirm that the status options are not part of my workflow.
6)  Drag any of these invalid status options to the unmapped columns area and they simply disappear.. thus re-affirming to me that they should not have been there.

So it appears the bug is that In order to create additional boards that share the same project the user has to go fix the column mappings.
fields.summary: Second board on project using simplified workflow shows statuses that aren't part of the workflow

fields.description:
Coming from a dedicated GreenHopper customer:

In GreenHopper 6.0.1 you can add plan ahead using multiple sprint markers which is great.

However, you cannot add sprint name and dates until you actually _start_ the sprint and that would be great to have as a functionality.
fields.summary: Add ability to set future sprint dates and names

fields.description:
As a Kanban teamlead I'd like to specify a work-in-progress limit based
on swimmlanes to enable the team to handle "prio-1-emergency-ASAP"-tasks
in a dedicated ASAP swimmlane whitout interfering the current WIP.

example:
- board has the standard 3 columns
- board has 2 swimmlanes: ASAP and OTHER
- WIP-limit on "in progress" is 3
- team is working on 3 tasks in OTHER (ASAP is empty)

now a real urgend issue is opened by support.
this issue should appear in the ASAP swimmlane and the team
has to start immediatly. 
The WIP-limit of "in progress" does not allow to start the
work on a 4th issue...

Therefore I want to be able to set diffrent WIP-limit for
diffrent swimmlanes
fields.summary: swimmlane sensitive WIP-limits

fields.description:
In [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+your+General+Project+Settings] we tell the customer:

{quote}
'Issue Link Type' — You can specify which link type the hierarchy plugin will use in this setting.
(info) This option will not be available unless the Links Hierarchy Reports plugin has been installed into JIRA first (see Managing JIRA's Plugins). The Link Hierarchy Reports plugin can be downloaded from the Atlassian Plugin Exchange site.
{quote}

In the [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.pyxis.jira.links.hierarchy.reports] we see that:
# The plugin is available until JIRA 4.4.5
# The plugin is Atlassian Labs, [...] not actively maintained or developed by Atlassian.

I feel slightly confused about the course of action: Should a customer install Link Hierarchy Reports plugin even if it is Atlassian Labs and not maintained?

Thanks.
fields.summary: GH 6.0 documentation suggesting use of Atlassian Labs plugin

fields.description: I would like to be able to rename the upcoming sprint 1, 2, 3, etc. Examples would be the dates or features to be included for planning purposed.
fields.summary: Ability to rename "Upcoming Sprint X"

fields.description: It would be great if there is an option to set the Classic Board as a default option in the {{Agile}} menu.
fields.summary: Option to Make the Classic Boards a Default View

fields.description: It would be nice to have a section that describes what a particular sprint is all about, since planning future sprints has been implemented in GreenHopper 6.0.
fields.summary: Comments Describing an Upcoming / Planned Sprint

fields.description:
The velocity chart and the sprint report should show an issue' story points value either of when the sprint started or when the issue got added to the sprint. During a sprint, SP values changes are visualised in the burndown chart (as a type of scope change), but these changes should not have an impact on either the velocity chart and sprint report.
 
Currently this is not the case. The sprint report shows the correct values, but the Velocity chart uses the values as of sprint completion time.
fields.summary: Velocity chart completed points use values at sprint completion time instead of sprint start time

fields.description:
The IC dev team have said the new code has  backwards compatibility.  Lets ensure that.

We need to get the new version from Slawek
fields.summary: Smoke test Issue Collector to ensure backwards compatibility

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: Any limit on the number of digits?
A: (/) Issue count should be unlimited (constraints currently limited to 999).

Q: Takes into account when multiple filters are on?
A: (/) Yes

Q: Properly hides issues that are hidden for a particular user?
A: (/)  for browse permissions

Q: Looks good in all browsers?
A: (/) Yes

Q: Looks good in wallboard mode?
A: (/) yes
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to see the count of visible (i.e. unfiltered) issues in the column header

fields.description:
You would normally only look at a sprint board once the sprint has started, and when a sprint has started the only valu ethat is relevant for any given sprint task is the remaining estimate. Therefore this should be visible directly on the rapid board cards in stead of the Original Time Estimate. 

This will give a far better overview of the sprint, when viewing the entire Rapid Board. 

As a bonus it would be very nice if the value is editable directly on the Rapid Board cards.

COS: 
- On work mode the lozenge will show remaining estimate
- For parent stores this will not include sub tasks
- Only if time tracking is enabled
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to see the Remaining Estimate on Rapid Board cards instead of the Original Time Estimate

fields.description:
It's quite frustrating using the 'Saved Filter' field on the RapidBoard config. As the filter doesn't do exact matches when suggesting autocomplete results, and only 20 autocomplete results are suggested without the option of viewing more.

I was trying to change the filter on a rapidboard to 'JIRA OnDemand Issue Tracking', however when I entered the filter name, the filter autocomplete suggested anything that matched 'JIRA' or 'Feature' or 'Tracking'. See screenshot.

If I know the exact name of my filter, I would expect it to match it exactly.
fields.summary: Please make the 'Saved Filter' autocomplete more precise
Would like to see sub-tasks estimation in the main task on the Plan Mode of the Rapid Board

fields.description: As an example, the "Update" field can be added to the Card Styles in Project Templates when accessing those settings via {{Administration > GreenHopper > Project Templates}}, but the field does not display in Agile view.  When accesing via {{Planning Mode > Tools > Configuration > Card Styles}} the field cannot be added and does not show up in the list of "available fields."  Any fields which are available and can be added show up immediately.
fields.summary: Editing via Project Templates (in Administration) allows adding of fields not possible or present in per-project templates
The issue count at the top of the columns in the Work board should honor the applied filters.

fields.description:
As pointed out by a dedicated customer, the GreenHopper [Chart Board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Viewing+the+Hour+Burndown+Chart] uses green and red colors that are easily interchangeable by color-blind individuals.

Is it possible to change these default values?
fields.summary: Make Chart Board color-blind friendly

fields.description:
The issue collector has been updated and it broke GH.

We need to make our code more robust (via try / catch) and also we need to delay the code so it happens off the critical path of the page load.

We also need to updated to the new issue collector way of doing things.

COS :

JAC can go away and we work
IC js can blow up and we work
IC isnt loaded until the last possible moment.
fields.summary: As a user I don't want issue collector impact performance and functionality

fields.description:
COS: 
- A link to "Read More" will expand the container to the full height.
- The box can be collapsed again.
fields.summary: As a supporter, I'd like exceptions to be collapsed by default, to allow users to continue to use the app without having a large error box on the screen

fields.description: Just like the planning board in the classic view of the boards, we were able to move subtasks from one parent to another during the planning phase.  Very useful tool when planning out stories and tasks.  With the new rapid boards, I do not see where this is possible now.  The subtasks are not in the same list on the rapid board plan phase and ability to move subtasks to a different parent did not carry over.  I would like the ability to move subtasks by dragging and dropping similar to what we had for the planning board.  Thanks.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to drag/move subtasks to different parent tasks in the plan phase of the rapid board

fields.description:
Guys, you've made incompatible changes to ranking API in 5.10.6 (in a patch version!) causing our plugin to lose connectivity with GreenHopper and some feedback from our customers -- this made me write this story.

1. Stability

I would like GreenHopper API to follow the same rules JIRA API follows. Backward-incompatible changes would advance major API version; forward-incompatible changes would advance minor API version; implementation details change would advance micro version.

I would suggest that unlike JIRA, GreenHopper API have its own version number, independent from GreenHopper plugin version. This will allow you to advance API version in minor releases - but it will be an explicit, visible change (which hopefully you'd mention in the Release Notes).

2. Usability

Right now we have to extract GreenHopper classes and instances with reflection, because there's no compile-time artifact that we can depend on. The API should be a separate artifact that both GreenHopper main body and the outside plugin can depend on. 

This artifact should have its own versioning (see above) and be published along with the sources for the API -- before or at the same time GreenHopper version using that API version is released.

Thanks for listening!
fields.summary: As a plugin developer, I'd like to have stable, usable GreenHopper API

fields.description:
In one support case, a user was probably exploring what the "Planning Board" under the context of a project that did not have any version but more than 11,000 issues (as the project seemed to be used to track customer support cases). For the request, 11,010 issues were loaded in the memory, and due to the fact that these issues were not found in the timeline cache, they were calculated from database one by one. The calculating of work log summary for 11,000+ issues from database obviously took a while and the user most likely refreshed the page a few times. And this led to OOME.

We would advise the customer not to enable GH on all projects to avoid this in the future.

But it would be good to check whether the logged in user has the permission to add new versions if that the project does not have any versions and decline the request if the user does not have permissions to add versions. And even if they do, it would be nice to ask them to confirm that they want to use versions in the project.

And while computing the work log summary, it would be great to update the calculation in while it is still in progress so that the user does not get frustrated for the long wait.
fields.summary: Better handling of "Planning Board" under the context of a project that has no version but lots of issues
Quick create javascript is causing problms with Prototype.js, especially in IE8

fields.description:
As a user of plain Jira and Greenhopper, I would expect the same list of issue operations in all Greenhopper boards that are also shown in plain Jira. I would expect that the same operation conditions are respected by Greenhopper that are used by plain Jira, even if these conditions are customized. This would 
* lead to a better integration of Jira and Greenhopper, 
* avoid the need to switch between both,
* would allow easier customization of conditions (one change - everywhere respected)

Technically, Greenhopper should do the same as the plain Jira navigator does for each issue to determine available operations (and transitions). Even the UI should be similar (e.g. no need for a "More Actions..." popup).
fields.summary: Greenhopper should show the same issue operations on boards as plain Jira does
As a user, I'd like to have a recent version of JIM automatically installed for me

fields.description: Currently while viewing the Rapid board, there is no indication of whether the board is a Kanban board or a Scrum board. It will be quite useful for users and administrators, if the type could be displayed somewhere on the board.
fields.summary: As a User/Admin I would like to know the type of the Rapid Board while viewing it

fields.description: It would be good to have epic/theme support in Rapid Board so as to preserve the grandparent-parent-children relationship; just as how the Classic Boards used to employ.
fields.summary: Epics and Themes in Rapid Board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-5576].
  {panel}

The visibility of Rapid Boards is based on the Shares of a filter. If a JIRA administrator shall do some changes in a Rapid Board configuration, he is only able to do so, if he is somehow included in the Share of the filter. 

This isn't the optimal in all cases.
- When using cross-project Rapid Boards, with the filter shared with a user group, but with the user group normally not including any JIRA administrators. That means that the Rapid Board is not visible to the JIRA admin and therefore the owner of the Rapid Board is the only one who can do configure the board. 
- When the board owner or one of the admins changes the board filter to a private one, they lock all other admins out of it. Neither JIRA admins nor users that are Board administrators cannot access the board because of the missing filter share.

That should be changes, so that a JIRA admin can see and configure all Rapid Boards, even if he is not included in the Shares of a filter. Alternatively, the "Board administrator" setting should override the filter share settings.
fields.summary: As a (board) administrator I'd like to access the board regardless of the filter shares
Hipchat notifications for GreenHopper

fields.description: In the interest of developing metrics related to how GreenHopper is used by our organisation, we would like to retrieve the rank field for a particular issue.
fields.summary: Would like to retrieve issue's current rank via SQL or API call

fields.description:
When getting familiar with the Rapid Board for Scrum, it can be confusing that the 'Start Sprint' button is disabled when a current sprint is In Progress.

Please add a click or hover action for the button that informs users that they can only start the sprint once the in-progress sprint is completed. Bonus points for indicating HOW to complete the in-progress sprint!

I've updated [Starting a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Starting+a+Sprint] to highlight this, but it would be ideal if users don't have to consult our documentation.
fields.summary: Why can't I start my Sprint? Help users learn within the UI

fields.description: It would be great if the fix version displayed on the Rapid Board's issue summary would be a link to the fix version page of that project.
fields.summary: Make fix version a link in the Agile board detail view

fields.description:
COS:
- Allow re-rank 
- Allow quick filter
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able use the work mode while an update is being performed (kill the spinner)

fields.description:
COS: 
- Detect when page loses focus and stop doing this so regularly 

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: How often does this poll? Can the user define this polling interval?
A: 30 sec. No, user can't define interval

Q: What if there was a change, then another change to undo that change? aka there is no effective delta?
A: The client side will receive the updated data and then decide its already up to date, thus ignore it

Q: What if the user has been logged out?
A: Thanks to Jason a separate logic automatically redirects to the login page when an ajax request fails due to being logged out. This works for all requests, be it filter change, detail view, or update poller. The question here probably is whether the update poller should really trigger this redirect...

Q: What if the user does not have permission to see the board? Do they still get notifications?
A: Why would the board open if they had no permission

Q: Any conflict if there was an error on the page as well?
A: Not handled

Q: Is there a way for a user to disable these notifications?
A: No

Q: Any conflict if I have multiple boards open in multiple tabs?
A: Should not. Each board will separately poll for updates though
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like the board to poll for staleness and provide a notification if there are changes at a sane interval
Allow more than one plugin to register to have a tab in the detail view, use icons in the tab header

fields.description:
Hi Rosie, 

This comment (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Tutorial+-+Planning+and+Estimating+work+for+an+Agile+team?focusedCommentId=297665474#comment-297665474) seems reasonable (you have probably already seen it):

"As a new Greenhopper user, there seems to be a big assumption that I already know or have configured JIRA - specifically, I have not idea how to create my team. Where do I add team members?  I guess that's a JIRA thing, there's not info in the GreenHopper 101. There should at least be a reference with a link - "Go here to learn how to set up your team"."

Could we do this?  

Thanks
fields.summary: Put link to creating users in JIRA in to the GH 101

fields.description: User names/login nams can be anything depending on the IT policy. We are synchronizing with Active Directory and our user names are sometimes short (or nicknames) as they are domain users. I heard of situations when people's user names are their phone numbers (more unique than names). I don't think user names are used anywhere in JIRA but here.
fields.summary: As a User I would like JIRA users to be presented by their names and not logins on the context creation screen so that I can filter even if login names are meaningless

fields.description: As a user i want to be able to group the many quick filters i have so that i can get a better overview instead of the rapid board wraps the quick filters and they end up taking many lines.
fields.summary: Allow users to group Quick Filters arbitrarily

fields.description:
Hi Rosie, 

Could you please document that Create Share Objects permission is required to create a Rapid Board? Maybe we need a permissions section in the admin section. 

You also need to be a project administrator for all of the projects on a board to create a new future sprint or move the future sprint marker, not sure if we've documented that? 

Thanks,
Shaun
fields.summary: Document permissions for Rapid Board

fields.description:
Are you guys using the same auto-suggesting project key code that we use? Because our version does not suggest numbers in the project key.
See attachments using JOD 5.2-m02.
fields.summary: Create project autosuggesting keys is using numbers

fields.description: The visibility of sub-tasks and their parents is very limited in the Kanban board. If we view the swimlanes as stories than it helps the visibility but this isn't ideal for a support team using Kanban. There should be a field on the detail view that allows us to see sub-tasks, parents, links, etc.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to have better visibility of sub-tasks in Kanban without Story swimlanes.

fields.description:
This comes from a dedicated customer:
!two-line list.png!

When viewing sub-tasks in the Task Board (two-line option is enabled), you have some space that seems blank for no reason. Is it possible to reduce this wasted space?
fields.summary: List Task Board View with two-line list option leaves space unused when it comes to sub-tasks

fields.description:
I use a MacBook with a touchpad during planning meetings.
It happens all the time that instead of scrolling the view I start dragging some random card and drop it in random places.

As there is no Undo functionality, or graphical indication of what I just dragged and from where, I think it would be much better to restrict dragging to those dotty few-pixel colorful strips that look just like drag handles, and don't allow dragging from the whole area of the card.

Fortunatelly Esc key seems to do the right thing if you notice what is happening and press it before the card is dropped in the new location.
fields.summary: Please make it harder to accidentally reorder stories when looking at the Sprint Plan view
As a user I would like to OR certain quick filters

fields.description: As an administrator, I would like to have an administrative option to disable the getting started dialog. This would also remove the link from the Agile menu.
fields.summary: Ability to disable the Getting Started dialog

fields.description:
At the moment, when a user started a sprint, that user can delete the Rapid board (associated to the current sprint) via Agile > Manage Rapid Boards, and click on the delete link.  

It would be convenience for the users to be reminded (or preventing) users that a deleting the Rapid Board does not necessarily complete/abort the sprint.
fields.summary: Prevent deleting a scrum board when there is an active sprint

fields.description:
The design page for this is here

https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/GHS-4704+Active+Sprint


Can we please close the related GHS-4704 issue when this is done.
fields.summary: Implement designs on the active sprint summary at the top of plan mode

fields.description:
COS:
- For historical sprints do not show this entry in the burndown
fields.summary: Store sprint created date and show on the burndown chart data table as the first line
As a forward planner, I'd like to be able to name future sprints

fields.description:
COS: 
- Display inline dialog with name, start and end date
- Button to finish
fields.summary: As a multi-team one backlog user, I'd like to be able to pick which sprint to finish when I close one

fields.description: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/GHS-5543+Sprint+Picker
fields.summary: As a multi-team one backlog user, I'd like to be able to pick which sprint I'm looking at on work mode (possibly quickfilters?)

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: How many sprints can be open at once?
A: No limit

Q: Is there any impact on reporting when multiple sprints are active?
A: (x) Not answered

Q: How do we know which report to jump to when juggling sprints in work mode?
A: (x) Not answered

Q: What happens when an active sprint is closed by some other user while you are working on it?
A: (x) Not answered

Q: What if i want to view different swimlane strategies in each of my active sprints?
A: Raise a feature request

Q: What happens when all issues are removed from an active sprint?
A: Existing problem, iirc there's an open bug to better handle this

Q: What if all issues from one sprint are moved to another active sprint?
A: As above

Q: Do we still jump to reports if an active sprint is still open?
A: (x) Not answered
fields.summary: As a multi-team one backlog user, I'd like to be able to start multiple sprints at once

fields.description:
- New structure always enabled
- Show no labs feature currently (important for ondemand, where we don't have analytics as a labs feature)
fields.summary: Remove new menu structure labs feature

fields.summary: Internal Server Error when ranking against a marker that has been deleted

fields.description: It seems to make a bit of sense since we must be going to server side to create the marker
fields.summary: We expect two separate sessions on the same board to learn about the other board's markers when one is added

fields.description:
According to https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/6569/how-do-you-burndown-story-points-in-greenhopper-on-a-daily-basis, Rapid board burn down is determined by the rightmost column on the rapid board, this should be change to be a configurable column specified by the user.

The reason for this is that right most columns might include QA/testing activities, that do not effectively represent development burn down,  
resulting in skewed burn down charts.
fields.summary: Rapid board burndown determiner

fields.description:
The latest version of the developer toolbox tries to register 'dt' which conflicts with our registration. 

This causes a Javascript exception, we should at least ignore this exception

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/71691/greenhopper-rapidboard-exception-cannot-bind-new-shortcut
fields.summary: Undocumented GreenHopper 'd' (delete) shortcut now conflicts with Developer Toolbox

fields.description: I like column constraints. However the red and yellow colors that are used don't work everywhere. Color blind people like me find the contrast of black text with red hard to read. Some dashboards would be improved by other colors.
fields.summary: Ability to configure column constraint colours

fields.description:
We would like to improve integration of our plugin Structure with GreenHopper. One thing that the users ask from us frequently is "we don't see the context of a given issue on the Rapid Board" - meaning, that you can't see the issue's position in a structure without visiting the issue page.

It would be great if GreenHopper provided an extension point that would allow us to add another tab on the issue preview panel. We would place a structure widget on that tab so the user can switch and see the structure pertaining to that issue without leaving Rapid Board.
fields.summary: As a JIRA plugin developer, I would like to add another tab to the issue preview panel

fields.description:
{{As a ScrumMaster, I'd like to have BurnUp Charts available on the Rapid Board}}

When determining team velocity, I'd like to view statistics as a burn up chart, instead of a burndown chart.
fields.summary: Burnup chart for Agile boards
Update base URL of help paths to point to 6.0 docs

fields.description: We can potentially gain a performance improvement in our check of which boards an issue appears on, by *not* executing searches with "override security". This is due to nested Saved Filters being slow to parse when security is being overridden.
fields.summary: Improve performance of View on Agile Board link in View Issue

fields.description:
When JIRA is behind the firewall and if the Greenhopper feedback module is enabled it throws javascript exceptions. This could be handled as a feature to have a global configuration which indicates to JIRA that internet connection should not be attempted (including UPM probably).

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as at 28th August 2012| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#49BD5F| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We hardened this code in GreenHopper 5.10.6 so that most users should not see errors of this sort. 

We've further hardened the code in the forthcoming GreenHopper 6.0.2. Once GreenHopper 6.0.2 is released all users will be able to upgrade to this version and be assured these errors are resolved. 

Thank you.

Regards,
Shaun Clowes
{panel}
fields.summary: Greenhopper Feedback Behind Firewall
Provide Create Issue button on iPad
Disable Attach File button on iPad

fields.summary: Ipad Spike

fields.description:
These should be broken into subtasks as they are handled.


* Fix scrolling in the details view when scrolled down in the view. It's a bit painful at the moment.
* Presentation mode button at the top when in iPad mode.
* More actions button at the top when in iPad mode.
* Plan mode:
** We can speed up the change handler on the issue element drag by removing it! At the moment we have a change handler applied globally and then on receiving the event create a jQuery object for the element, and if it has a issue class throw it away. Instead, we can bind the change handler for the marker class only, and avoid this work.
** We can speed up the marker change handler through performing a check on current issue position vs. old issue position, and doing an incremental update. This would depend on a issue key -> issue position map, I think we have one already?
fields.summary: iPad improvements

fields.description:
Hi Rosie, 

We continue to get requests about how to get Story Points to show up for issue types other than Story and Epic. 

Maybe we should include this info on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Story+Point in a big box? 

Is there anywhere else we could put this that would get Google attention? Could we maybe have a FAQ?
fields.summary: Further documentation on how to set Story Points up for Bugs and other issue types

fields.description:
This is more an improvement request than a bug, but from a REST API perspective this is incorrect.

We currently return 401 Unauthorised errors from REST calls when either a user is not authenticated or when a user is not permitted to do something. [This page|http://stackoverflow.com/a/6937030] outlines the distinction between 401 and 403.

We should update our code to serve 403 errors for things such as failed permissions.
fields.summary: GreenHopper Web Exceptions do not differentiate between Unauthorised and Forbidden
Keyboard shortcuts navigate through hidden issues when instant filter is on

fields.description: Should really be able to bulk edit selected issues / all issues on the Rapid Board planning view.
fields.summary: Should be able to bulk edit selected issues / all issues in Rapid Board Planning view

fields.description: When viewing the Rapid Board Planning view it's great to be able to see Original Estimate instead of Story Points. However this should really be Remaining Estimate as some tasks may have had a few days already spent on them before deciding to abandon them. These half-done tasks have their full estimate in the plan which is incorrect.
fields.summary: Should be able to display Remaining Estimate on planning board

fields.description: I made a quickfiter on our KANBAN board to see the tickets with a due date, but this important info for these tickets doesn't appear in de detail view.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to see the due date of an issue in the detail view in the rapid board
Put a prominent link to GreenHopper 101 on getting started to help evaluators

fields.description:
Hi team,

The chart displayed by Agile->Released Board->Project Overview->Value Chart only shows the first 23 releases. The 24th and subsequent releases are not shown. I would like the chart to display either the last N releases (e.g. 20) or to be able to mark individual (old) releases so they do not appear in the chart.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Charts on released board should give the option to select versions to be displayed

fields.description:
When you've scrolled down any amount at all on the Rapid Board and you attempt to drag an issue card, the issue card's position is offset from the cursor.  The position of the issue card seems relative to the top of the page not the viewport.

Eg. If you've scrolled down 40px, and you attempt to drag a card, the card appears 40px higher than cursor when being dragged.  If you've scrolled 1 viewport's height down the card isn't visible at all.  But dragging and dropping still works properly even though you can't see the card (it uses cursor position).

Haven't noticed this before when I was using Safari on Snow Leopard. Bug doesn't manifest itself in Chrome.
fields.summary: Incorrect position when Dragging & Dropping Issues Cards in Rapid Board on Safari on Lion [Version 5.1.6 (7534.56.5)]

fields.description:
When planning a SCRUM sprint across multiple projects (using the new Rapid-board), it would be very nice to be able to highlight issues related to the different projects, similar to what can be done in the Agile Task Board today. The Highlight feature could be based on filters, similar to the Quick Filter functionality, but instead of filtering out and only showing the issues that match the filter, it would be more practical to filter by highlighting the issues matching the filter.
The reason for this is that when prioritizing the backlog, I need to prioritize issues across projects. If I use the QuickFilters today to only see issues from one specific project, and then start to reorganize the order of the issues, I have no control of how the reordering affects the other projects. By leaving all issues in the list and just highlighting the issues belonging to one filter, I will still be able to maintain control of the order also between the projects.
fields.summary: As a SCRUM user (PO) doing cross-project sprint planning with the RapidBoard, I would like to be able to highlight issues based on filtering

fields.description:
As a user I want to create Rapid Board columns that do not map to an existing workflow status. E.g. to get a story approved by product design.

I believe this should be possible by tracking the virtual status in another hidden custom field similar to the Sprint field.
fields.summary: Virtual Status Columns in Rapid Board
